forumNotes.author: benny59
forumNotes.content:
My aim is to use my Lacie 320 GB to keep a library of distributions, possibly under iso format for:  

- praticing new distributions (my production system is Mint, now LMDE, rollin edition, is very fast and flexible)  

- creating a platform independent portable os/application/data stack for work and family sites  

- keeping a handy swiss knife when friends call you for rescuing their win systems.  

The major constrain is to minimize the maintenance when new releases are issued.  

for this reason I organized my LaCie 320GB, initially with gujin, the most flexible bootloader I could find for this purpose.  

Most Distributions can be fired in two basic ways:  
- gujin can detect and fire iso distributions (i.e. all Ubuntu derivatives)  
- creating 15 extended partitions, say 700MB size and with dd if=distr.iso of=/dev/sdbx gujin can fire distributions with no suitable cheatcodes for iso booting. (i.e. Sabayon family, Puppy family, Utitlex, PCLinuxOS...)  

I am very happy about this solution, although I run into some limitations which pushed me to move ahead to study grub4dos and extend my bulk of distributions.  

- UBCD4WIN, REACTOS cannot be fired with the mentioned systems  
- not all PCs can fire gujin for some reason (pls notice that my LaCie system can be considered a "production system" so I am not going to back up the whole data for each modification, which must work.  

So my strategy is to change the bootloader to grub4dos and keep firing gujin for the so far so good, and extend with the missing pieces.  

I already made some tests and the integrated approach is promising, although gujin does not see all the partitions it did before, and I have to solve some mappings issues.  

Having said so I am available to share more specific details and open to receive suggestions on how to configure grub4dos.  

cheers  
benny
